question: A 14-year-old boy presents with bilateral foot deformity. On examination thickened peripheral nerves and sensory gait ataxia is observed. On biopsy of the nerve, a typical onion bulb appearance is noted. The probable diagnosis is?
exp: Image shows presence of Pes Cavus which indicates distal muscle weakness. Concomitant sensory deficit leads to Gait ataxia. Nerve biopsy: Classical onion bulb appearance s/o Charcot Marie Tooth disease. Charcot Marie Tooth disease ( Hereditary sensorimotor neuropathy) manifests as: Peroneal muscle dystrophy Stork leg appearance Thickened nerves N. biopsy: Onion bulb appearance Distal weakness ( Flexion contractures)

question: Post-herpetic neuralgia is seen after?
exp: Post-herpetic neuralgia is neuropathic pain seen after 30 days(4 weeks) of onset of rash. Immunocompromised hosts are more prone to neurological complications like: Encephalitis Myelitis Cranial and peripheral nerve palsies Acute retinal necrosis. Management: 1. Wet compresses using burrows solution applied 4-5 times/ day are useful breaking vesicles and remove serum and crust. 2. Valacyclovir, Famcyclovir for 7-10 day
